Ooc: gotchya.

BIC:

Tucson nods and turns to get ready for a little alone =
time with Talon.

Yet he turns back to Wheelie.

" If that's what you want,=
 that's fine by me, Wheelie.  But keep in mind, it doesn't hurt to have a f=
riend as well as a comrade by your side. I learned that many vorns ago when=
 I started working with the Autobots.  And yes war is a difficult time and =
we can not weaken our defenses but, it doesn't mean we have to be anti soci=
al either.  Strength is in numbers.  That was one of Master Yokitron's word=
s."

Tucson backs into his private quarters and closes the door softly.

Pe=
rpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Jul 6, 2011, at 10:20 PM, "=
adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wrote:

> 
> > 
> > Meanwhile, in Tucson=
's quarters, Tucson looks down at Wheelie and realizes that he had no idea =
of his change of status, seeing that the last time they were together Tucso=
n was just an average comrade, just a slight larger than Wheelie. He heaves=
 a sigh and kneels down to Wheelie.
> > 
> > " I was going to give you a le=
cture and a warning but I realize you just comeback online after many vorns=
 . You were not aware of my change of status to Prime office and perhaps mi=
stook me for my previous status. I'll let it go this one time, Wheelie but =
keep in mind that a Prime is a Prime no matter who they are. All right, you=
're free to roam the Auto base now. Please try not to get sent to my office=
 again, okay?"
> > 
> > With a smile of understanding, Tucson opens the doo=
r to let Wheelie go on his way. Once having let Wheelie free, he waits for =
Talon with a light hearted smile on his face.
> > 
> 
> OOC - Uhm, I posted=
 Wheelie leaving your quarters and he never entered them in the first place=
, then him heading out. So there's no way he coudl have been there, and he =
wouldn't have gone back over to them! So will pose this as taking place out=
 in the ship corridors. Thanks!
> 
> Also, I appreciate your posting, but i=
t's sort of weird how you have each and every character of your's coming up=
, then doing something to me, then knowing each and every thing that happen=
ed to each adn every other one that did, and them all having the exact same=
 opinions over on everyone as everyone else did. 
> 
> Also, unless your ch=
aracte ris asuperior officer who's going to emphatically order him to do so=
mething, please don't pose him going somewhere far else after you for a set=
up. Since it's hideously unrealistic for him to go back to Tuscon's quarter=
s twice now as you've posed him doing when he's not especially fond of Tusc=
on, nor him following someone else as well when I posd him trying to leave.=
 So, if going to go somewhere with him, please give me a cahnce to respond =
to it ahead of time. It's two times you posed him extensively going with yo=
ur characters when it was not in character for him to do so.
> 
> If your c=
haracters have had interactions with him in the past or things I should kno=
w of, let me know? As I have no idea where Wheelie interacted with Tuscon o=
r how they would have remotely konwn of one another, and you've posted repe=
aetdly that Tuscon knows him from the past, when I have no idea of that.
> =

> So again, if they've had interactions as NPC's, let me know their generi=
c history so I can respond appropriately. If he's going to be told to go so=
mewhere wtih someone, either give me a chance to respond appropriately if h=
e does or not, or make it something like a specific order in the case someo=
ne is a superior. And it's also rather weird how your characers come up fro=
m nowhere, all have the exact same opininos and back one another up to the =
hilt on thier interactions and everything. I feel kind of wedged into a cor=
ner by this.
> 
> I understand I'm new to the gruop and you've been here mu=
ch longer, I just feel rather hemmed in on the character with what you're d=
oing and am confused as to how things operate, and how you have all of your=
 alts congregating and making me feel pressed into a corner.
> 
> Anyways, =
sorry if this is coming fof a bit too negative, thank you very much for the=
 welcome here and for playing wtih me and interacting with Wheelie.
> 
> <B=
ack In Character>
> 
> Wheelie, having met Tuscon up in the hall, gazes ove=
r at him, "What is this with all of you? You're back and forth whatever I d=
o. This is what Prime is, just a rank? It seems like it's just sort of dank=
. We had four of five in a room, that's not a level of doom and gloom."
> 
=
> Then, walking away from Tuscon, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're good=
 with all of your friends, congrualtions on the promotion and to whatever e=
nds. But we, we were never friends. We went back and forth in our ways, and=
 I respect your orders for these days. But we're not here to have fun, we'r=
e here to fight and run and gun."
> 
> Wheelie leaning against the wall, "I=
'll work wtih you, if you do tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell. I'd =
prefer to keep my own advice, and I appreciate your friends, they try and b=
e nice. But don't have them ganging up on me and telling me what to do, or =
how you'll react, or on you'll I chew. So by al lmeans, give me some space,=
 we're here to fight for the future of our race."
> 
> 

--Apple-Mail-16-988987510

orking with the Autobots.  And yes war is a difficult time and we can =

    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
   =
   <p><br>
> <br>
> Meanwhile, in Tucson's quarters, Tucson looks dow=
n at Wheelie and realizes that he had no idea of his change of status, seei=
ng that the last time they were together Tucson was just an average comrade=
, just a slight larger than Wheelie.  He heaves a sigh and kneels down to W=
heelie.<br>
> <br>
> " I was going to give you a lecture and a warnin=
g but I realize you just comeback online after many vorns .   You were not =
aware of my change of status to Prime office and perhaps mistook me for my =
previous status.  I'll let it go this one time, Wheelie but keep in mind th=
at a Prime is a Prime no matter who they are.   All right, you're free to r=
oam the Auto base now.  Please try not to get sent to my office again, okay=
?"<br>
> <br>
> With a smile of understanding, Tucson opens the door =
to let Wheelie go on his   way.   Once having let Wheelie free, he waits fo=
r Talon with a light hearted smile on his face.<br>
> <br>
<br>
OOC - Uh=
m, I posted Wheelie leaving your quarters and he never entered them in the =
first place, then him heading out.  So there's no way he coudl have been th=
ere, and he wouldn't have gone back over to them!  So will pose this as tak=
ing place out in the ship corridors.  Thanks!<br>
<br>
Also, I appreciate y=
our posting, but it's sort of weird how you have each and every character o=
f your's coming up, then doing something to me, then knowing each and every=
 thing that happened to each adn every other one that did, and them all hav=
ing the exact same opinions over on everyone as everyone else did.  <br>
<b=
r>
Also, unless your characte ris  asuperior officer who's going to emphati=
cally order him to do something, please don't pose him going somewhere far =
else after you for a setup.  Since it's hideously unrealistic for him to go=
 back to Tuscon's quarters twice now as you've posed him doing when he's no=
t especially fond of Tuscon, nor him following someone else as well when I =
posd him trying to leave.  So, if going to go somewhere with him, please gi=
ve me a cahnce to respond to it ahead of time.  It's two times you posed hi=
m extensively going with your characters when it was not in character for h=
im to do so.<br>
<br>
If your characters have had interactions with him in =
the past or things I should know of, let me know?  As I have no idea where =
Wheelie interacted with Tuscon or how they would have remotely konwn of one=
 another, and you've posted repeaetdly that Tuscon knows him from the past,=
 when I have no idea of that.<br>
<br>
So again, if they've had interaction=
s as NPC's, let me know their generic history so I can respond appropriatel=
y.  If he's going to be told to go somewhere wtih someone, either give me a=
 chance to respond appropriately if he does or not, or make it something li=
ke a specific order in the case someone is a superior.  And it's also rathe=
r weird how your characers come up from nowhere, all have the exact same op=
ininos and back one another up to the hilt on thier interactions and everyt=
hing.  I feel kind of wedged into a corner by this.<br>
<br>
I understand I=
'm new to the gruop and you've been here much longer, I just feel rather he=
mmed in on the character with what you're doing and am confused as to how t=
hings operate, and how you have all of your alts congregating and making me=
 feel pressed into a corner.<br>
<br>
Anyways, sorry if this is coming fof =
a bit too negative, thank you very much for the welcome here and for playin=
g wtih me and interacting with Wheelie.<br>
<br>
<Back In Character><=
br>
<br>
Wheelie, having met Tuscon up in the hall, gazes over at him, "Wha=
t is this with all of you?  You're back and forth whatever I do.  This is w=
hat Prime is, just a rank?  It seems like it's just sort of dank.  We had f=
our of five in a room, that's not a level of doom and gloom."<br>
<br>
Then=
, walking away from Tuscon, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're good with =
all of your friends, congrualtions on the promotion and to whatever ends.  =
But we, we were never friends.  We went back and forth in our ways, and I r=
espect your orders for these days.  But we're not here to have fun, we're h=
ere to fight and run and gun."<br>
<br>
Wheelie leaning against the wall, "=
I'll work wtih you, if you do tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell.  I'=
d prefer to keep my own advice, and I appreciate your friends, they try and=
 be nice.  But don't have them ganging up on me and telling me what to do, =
or how you'll react, or on you'll I chew.  So by al lmeans, give me some sp=
ace, we're here to fight for the future of our race."<br>
<br>
</p>
